text: The McCart Fire Lookout, near Sula, Montana, was built in 1939. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1996. It is an L-4 Fire Lookout, located at elevation, about south of the East Fork Forest Service Station in Bitterroot National Forest. With It was named for Bill McCart, a longtime National Forest Service employee in the East Fork District (now Sula District). ==References== Category:Fire lookout towers in Montana Category:National Register of Historic Places in Ravalli County, Montana Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1939
title: McCart Fire Lookout
